metadata.Title: CVE-2021-4009 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in xorg-x11-server in versions before 21.1.2 and before 1.20.14. An out-of-bounds access can occur in the SProcXFixesCreatePointerBarrier function. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4009` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
xdmx-tools - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
xmir - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
xnest - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
xorg-server-source - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
xserver-common - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
xserver-xorg-xmir - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
xvfb - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
xwayland - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

xorg-server-source-hwe-18.04 - 2:1.20.8-2ubuntu2.2~18.04.6
